required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Aorto-iliac Endovascular Interventions With and Without the EndoNaut Workstation
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Aorto-iliac Endovascular Interventions With and Without the EndoNaut Workstation

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this retrospective, multicenter study is to demonstrate that the use of EndoNaut for aortoiliac endovascular procedures has a clinical impact for the patient (reduction in irradiation and the volume of contrast product) as well as for the nursing staff (reduction irradiation) compared to procedures performed without EndoNaut.

detailed_description.textblock: Minimally invasive endovascular interventions are increasingly replacing conventional surgeries, and have become the therapeutic benchmark for a large number of pathologies thanks in particular to advances in image-guided therapy. Therenva offers a comprehensive and consistent lightweight navigation solution (EndoNautÂ®) for endovascular procedures. This navigation station makes it possible to secure and guide the interventional gesture by providing relevant information extracted during the preoperative phase. This information is rendered in augmented reality using artificial intelligence algorithms and digital simulation. This alternative solution to a hybrid room, but which offers equivalent functionality, is compatible with all operating rooms, regardless of the interventional environment. Benefits of imaging fusion remain to be assessed on a larger scale. The aim of this multicenter study is to demonstrate that the use of EndoNaut for aortoiliac endovascular procedures has a clinical impact for the patient (reduction in irradiation and the volume of contrast product) as well as for the nursing staff (reduction irradiation) compared to procedures performed without EndoNaut.

primary_outcome.measure: Volume of contrast product used during the routine care procedure (ml)
Irradiation parameters: evaluation of the Fluoroscopy duration (min)
primary_outcome.description: Parameter given by the X-ray imaging device
Parameter given by the X-ray imaging device

primary_outcome.measure: Irradiation parameters: measurement of air Kerma (mGy)
primary_outcome.description: Parameter given by the X-ray imaging device

arm_group.description: Endovascular interventions using the EndoNaut workstation. 3D image fusion is used for overlaying arterial information on top of fluoroscopic images
Control group, endovascular interventions without 3D image fusion

study_pop.textblock: Male and female patients with unilateral or bilateral common iliac aneurysm or stenosis, treated with endovascular technique

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Unilateral or bilateral aorto-iliac or iliac aneurysm/stenosis
- Suitable for endovascular repair
- Major patients
- Patients not opposed to their participation in the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients requiring conventional surgical revascularization.
